description: Thick leather body armor that has been hardened via chemical treatment.  Light and strong.
Leg and body armor made from the exoskeletons of insects.
Leg and body armor crafted from the carefully cleaned and pruned biosilicified exoskeletons of acidic ants.  Acid-resistant but brittle.
Thick body armor made from furs.
A full suit of thick leather body armor.  Light and comfortable.
A suit of Gothic plate armor.  The metal shows signs of rust and corrosion, and the leather straps are tattered.

A full set of armor hammered out from sheet metal and tied in place with leather straps and belts.  It's crude, heavy, and uncomfortable, but damn protective.  Now, you're a true Post-Apocalyptic Warrior.
A full set of armor hammered out from sheet metal and case hardened for added protection.  Perfect for keeping all your fleshy bits safe from zombie teeth.

A full set of armor hammered out from sheet metal and tied in place with leather straps and belts, with a doubly-thick chest guard to keep all your important organs safe.  You might be as mobile as a refrigerator wearing all this, but that's the price to pay to keep your flesh attached.

name.str: heavy case hardened sheet metal armor

description: A full set of armor hammered out from sheet metal and case hardened for extra protection, with a doubly-thick chest guard.  The Ned Kelly gang would be proud.
A full set of steel armor made from sheet metal hammered into shape and attached with chainmail covering the gaps.  For the modern knight on a budget.

A full set of steel armor made from sheet metal hammered into shape and attached with chainmail covering the gaps, with an extra-thick chestpiece.  About as heavy as a car but nowhere near as mobile, this suit is nonetheless quite protective.

A full set of steel armor made from sheet metal hammered into shape, attached with chainmail, and case-hardened for extra strength.  It might be crude and uncomfortably heavy, but it was clearly made by a skilled metalworker and offers excellent protection.

name.str: heavy case hardened junkyard plate armor

description: A full set of steel armor made from sheet metal hammered into shape, attached with chainmail, with a double-thick chestpiece, and case-hardened for extra strength.  Top-of-the-line in armor that looks like it was made from banged-up lockers, for the skilled metalworker that values protection over being able to move.
A light suit of plate armor with a 2mm thick chestpiece.  This one has been made with mild steel.

name.str: XL mild steel light plate armor

description: A light suit of plate armor with a 2mm thick chestpiece.  Made with tougher medium steel, this suit offers solid protection.

name.str: XL mild steel light plate armor

description: A light suit of plate armor with a 2mm thick chestpiece.  Made with high carbon steel, offering excellent protection.

name.str: XL high steel light plate armor

description: A light suit of plate armor with a 2mm thick chestpiece.  The mild steel has been case hardened, offering superior protection.

name.str: XL case hardened light plate armor

description: A light suit of plate armor with a 2mm thick chestpiece.  The medium steel has been quenched and tempered, offering top-of-the-line protection.
A suit of plate armor with a 4mm thick chestpiece.  This one has been made with mild steel.
A suit of plate armor with a 4mm thick chestpiece.  Made with tougher medium steel, this suit offers solid protection.
A suit of plate armor with a 4mm thick chestpiece.  Made with high carbon steel, offering excellent protection.
A suit of plate armor with a 4mm thick chestpiece.  The mild steel has been case hardened, offering superior protection.
A suit of plate armor with a 4mm thick chestpiece.  The medium steel has been quenched and tempered, offering top-of-the-line protection.
A heavy suit of plate armor with a 6mm thick chestpiece.  This one has been made with mild steel.

name.str: XL mild steel heavy plate armor

description: A heavy suit of plate armor with a 6mm thick chestpiece.  Made with tougher medium steel, this suit offers solid protection.

name.str: XL mild steel heavy plate armor

description: A heavy suit of plate armor with a 6mm thick chestpiece.  Made with high carbon steel, offering excellent protection.

name.str: XL high steel heavy plate armor

description: A heavy suit of plate armor with a 6mm thick chestpiece.  The mild steel has been case hardened, offering superior protection.

name.str: XL case hardened heavy plate armor

description: A heavy suit of plate armor with a 6mm thick chestpiece.  The medium steel has been quenched and tempered, offering top-of-the-line protection.
Thick leather body armor that has been reinforced with strategically-placed metal plates.
An extremely heavy suit of ornamental armor.  The metal shows signs of rust and corrosion, and the leather straps are tattered.

A full suit of black plastic body armor plates used by riot police.  Cleverly placed velcro straps secure each piece, resulting in slightly less encumbrance then its constituent parts.  Molle webbing is attached to the torso and the word POLICE is emblazoned across the front.
An ornamental suit of Japanese samurai armor.
A suit of armor made from scraps of metal secured by simple strings to cloth wraps; the loose collection of plates provides decent but uncomfortable protection.
A suit of armor made from thick chunks of rubber tire secured by simple strings; the loose collection of rubber plates provides decent but not the most convenient protection.

A white suit commonly worn by professional beekeepers with straps on your ankles and wrists to prevent bees from flying in.  It's not a very tough fabric, but it's lightweight and has plenty of storage thanks to a chest pocket.
A fully customized chainmail outfit, leaving the head uncovered.  Combine with an aketon or other padded layer for optimal protection.
A fully customized mild steel chainmail outfit, leaving the head uncovered.  Combine with an aketon or other padded layer for optimal protection.
//: Should be lighter when irl hauberk as it does not cover legs

description: A fully customized medium steel chainmail outfit, leaving the head uncovered.  Combine with an aketon or other padded layer for optimal protection.
A fully customized high steel chainmail outfit, leaving the head uncovered.  Combine with an aketon or other padded layer for optimal protection.
A fully customized hardened steel chainmail outfit, leaving the head uncovered.  Combine with an aketon or other padded layer for optimal protection.
A fully customized tempered steel chainmail outfit, leaving the head uncovered.  Combine with an aketon or other padded layer for optimal protection.
A fully customized chainmail suit.  The metal shows signs of rust and corrosion.  Combine with an aketon or other padded layer for optimal protection.
A fully customized mild steel chainmail suit.  Combine with an aketon or other padded layer for optimal protection.
A fully customized medium steel chainmail suit.  Combine with an aketon or other padded layer for optimal protection.
A fully customized high steel chainmail suit.  Combine with an aketon or other padded layer for optimal protection.
A fully customized hardened steel chainmail suit.  Combine with an aketon or other padded layer for optimal protection.
A fully customized tempered steel chainmail suit.  Combine with an aketon or other padded layer for optimal protection.
A fully customized chainmail suit that can be worn over your normal clothing.  The suit is conductively interconnected with a cage covering the face, protecting against electricity.
A simple hazardous materials handling suit.  Though somewhat restrictive and fragile, wearing it will provide excellent protection against ambient radiation.
A flame-resistant whole-body garment worn by firefighters as protection against extreme heat.  It requires a separate gas mask for full protection against smoke.

Designed to stop the injuries of dog bites, this thick, one piece suit is often used in the rehabilitation of abused animals and in training dogs by the police and military.  A base layer of aramid fabric has had strips of soft body armor sewn into it to mimic quilting, and to soften the blunt of animals jumping, slashing, or pouncing on the wearer.

armor.//: skip second entry for arm encumbrance

description: A padded greatcoat assembled by quilting readily available fabric and stuffing the layers with waste fabric or horse hair that was intended as standalone armor, being too thick to comfortably fit a cuirass over.  Likely either a historical artifact or a low-quality reproduction.  Though inferior to a proper layered aketon or gambeson it still offers decent protection.

A thick padded surcoat assembled by quilting readily available fabric and stuffing the layers with waste fabric or horse hair that was intended as standalone armor, being too thick to comfortably fit a cuirass over.  Likely either a historical artifact or a low-quality reproduction.  Though inferior to a proper layered gambeson its sheer thickness is still quite protective.
Thick pants made of quilted fabric, meant to be worn alongside a gambeson under or without armor.

name.str_pl: pairs of XL arming pants
pairs of XL arming pants

//-1: Going off the Rule of Nines for body proportions and assuming about 20 ft sq for the whole surface area of the body
//: roughly 0.25mm per sheet of canvas making this a 14-layer jack, sheets are 1x2 feet. 49 sheets for the vest and 18 sheets for the arms (67 total).
//1: human torso is about 7 sq. feet.  76g (canvas) x 14 (layers) x 3.5 (surface area) = 3724g
//2: human arms is about 3 sq. feet.  76g (canvas) x 12 (layers) x 1.5 (surface area) = 1368g
description: A thick cloth jack, intended to be worn below metal armor.  This one is made of over a dozen layers of tough canvas, and it provides fairly decent protection on its own.

//: surface area of XL body assumed to be 50% greater and materials used are also 50% greater.
surface area of XL body assumed to be 75% size and materials used are also 75% as much.
roughly 0.25mm per sheet of canvas making this a 14-layer jack, sheets are 1x2 feet. 49 sheets total.

name.str_pl: pairs of canvas arming pants

description: Tough cloth pants worn alongside an aketon underneath metal armor.  These are made of many layers of canvas offering solid protection.

//: surface area of XL body assumed to be 50% greater and materials used are also 50% greater.

name.str_pl: pairs of XL canvas arming pants

//: surface area of XL body assumed to be 75% size and materials used are also 75% as much.

name.str_pl: pairs of XS canvas arming pants

//: roughly 0.25mm per sheet of canvas making this 8 layers, sheets are 1x2 feet. 10 sheets total
//1: human head total is about 2.5 sq. feet.  76g (canvas) x 8 (layers) x 1.25 (surface area) = 760g
description: A cloth coif with neck and forehead protection.  Resting on your shoulders, it serves as padding for a helmet.  Though it's pretty warm, it is constructed of tough canvas and provides substantial protection even on its own.

//: surface area of XL body assumed to be 50% greater and materials used are also 50% greater.
surface area of XL body assumed to be 75% size and materials used are also 75% as much.
roughly 0.25mm per sheet of canvas making this 8 layers, sheets are 1x2 feet. 4 sheets total
//1: human hands assumed to be about 1 sq ft total, 76g (canvas) x 8 (layers) x 0.5 (surface area) = 304g

name.str_pl: pairs of canvas arming gloves

description: Tough gloves made of canvas cloth, thin enough to wear under metal gauntlets.  They help to keep your hands safe during a fight.

//: surface area of XL body assumed to be 50% greater and materials used are also 50% greater.

name.str_pl: pairs of XL canvas arming gloves

//: surface area of XL body assumed to be 75% size and materials used are also 75% as much.

name.str_pl: pairs of XS canvas arming gloves

//-1: Going off the Rule of Nines for body proportions and assuming about 20 ft sq in total
//: roughly 0.25mm per sheet of canvas making this a 30-layer jack, sheets are 1x2 feet. 105 sheets for the vest and 36 sheets for the arms (141 total).
//1: human torso is about 7 sq. feet.  76g (canvas) x 30 (layers) x 3.5 (surface area) = 7980g
//2: human arms is about 3 sq. feet.  76g (canvas) x 24 (layers) x 1.5 (surface area) = 2736g
//3: 8 layers thick waist. human waist is about 3ft circumference with the extra padding, and reaches to about below knees. doesn't usually cover the whole circumference so guessing about 1.5x2.5x8 total surface area divided by 1x2 ft for about 15-18 extra sheets, about 1140g if 15 sheets.
description: A thick cloth greatcoat intended to be worn as standalone armor, as it's a little too thick to comfortably add chainmail or a cuirass on top.  Made of thirty layers of tough canvas, this will protect you from almost everything, but it's very heavy and warm.  The sleeves are a bit thinner for flexibility and it drapes below your legs, providing additional protection there.

surface area of XL body assumed to be 75% size and materials used are also 75% as much.

description: A thick cloth surcoat intended to be worn as standalone armor, as it's a little too thick to comfortably add chainmail or a cuirass on top.  Made of thirty layers of tough canvas, this will protect you from almost everything, but it's very heavy and warm.  It drapes below your legs, providing additional protection there, and it lacks sleeves entirely.

description: Tough, extremely thick cloth pants worn on their own alongside a gambeson.  These are made of a huge number of canvas layers offering very solid protection, though they're too thick to easily add metal armor on top and are both stuffy and restrictive.

name.str_pl: pairs of XS wool arming gloves

//-1: Going off the Rule of Nines for body proportions and assuming about 20 ft sq in total
//: This is made out of quilts rather than sheets because felt is very low density and would need to be very thick - general wool has 1.4g/cm^3 however.
//0: I am treating this as though it were made of canvas or nylon sheets with a density of 1.4 instead of 1.6 or 1.14.
//1: human torso is about 7 sq. feet.  65g (wool) x 30 (layers) x 3.5 (surface area) = 6825g
//2: human arms is about 3 sq. feet.  65g (wool) x 24 (layers) x 1.5 (surface area) = 2340g
//3: 8 layers thick waist. human waist is about 3ft circumference with the extra padding, and reaches to about below knees. doesn't usually cover the whole circumference so guessing about 1.5x2.5x8 total surface area divided by 1x2 ft for about 15-18 extra sheets, about 975g if 15 sheets.
description: A thick cloth greatcoat intended to be worn as standalone armor, as it's a little too thick to comfortably add chainmail or a cuirass on top.  Made of thickly layered wool quilting, this will protect you from almost everything, but it's very heavy and warm.  The sleeves are a bit thinner for flexibility and it drapes below your legs, providing additional protection there.

//: surface area of XL body assumed to be 50% greater and materials used are also 50% greater.

description: A thick cloth surcoat intended to be worn as standalone armor, as it's a little too thick to comfortably add chainmail or a cuirass on top.  Made of thickly layered wool quilting, this will protect you from almost everything, but it's very heavy and warm.  It drapes below your legs, providing additional protection there, and it lacks sleeves entirely.

This is made out of quilts rather than sheets because felt is very low density and would need to be very thick - general wool has 1.4g/cm^3 however.
//0: I am treating this as though it were made of canvas or nylon sheets with a density of 1.4 instead of 1.6 or 1.14.
//1: human legs is about 6 sq. feet.  65g (wool) x 24 (layers) x 3 (surface area) = 4680g

name.str_pl: pairs of wool heavy arming pants

description: Tough, extremely thick cloth pants worn on their own alongside a gambeson.  These are made of thickly layered wool quilting offering very solid protection, though they're too thick to easily add metal armor on top and are both stuffy and restrictive.

//: surface area of XL body assumed to be 50% greater and materials used are also 50% greater.

//: This is made out of quilts rather than sheets because felt is very low density and would need to be very thick - general wool has 1.4g/cm^3 however.
//0: I am treating this as though it were made of canvas or nylon sheets with a density of 1.4 instead of 1.6 or 1.14.
//1: human hands assumed to be about 1 sq ft total, 65g (wool) x 8 (layers) x 0.5 (surface area) = 260g
//2: on top of that, additional 2x as thick layer on about 60% of the hand, so adding another 5 sheets for 9 total (585 g)

name.str_pl: pairs of wool arming mittens

description: Very thick wool gauntlets worn in lieu of metal or leather armor.  Though they make it hard to do anything other than swing a weapon, and they're very warm, they offer excellent protection.

armor.//a: technically, only covering 60% ish - inner hand is thinner - but fist will be clenched so inner hand should not really be hit

description: An impermeable whole-body garment worn as protection against hazardous materials.  Restrictive and fragile, wearing it will provide complete protection against ambient radiation.  It requires a separate gas mask for full protection.
A snug body suit made from thin and lightweight Nomex fire-resistant fabric.  Tough yet breathable, it is light and comfortable to wear under clothing.

A lightweight environmental suit incorporating Kevlar-lined boots and gloves, worn by Hub personnel in their rare forays aboveground.  Colored brown and blue, the white seal of Hub 01 is embroidered on both of its upper arms.  It requires a separate gas mask for full protection.
//: 2mm Nomex across the entire suit to provide hazmat properties. Hands and feet reinforced/shaped with other materials to provide full-body hazmat protection with minimal encumbrance.

material.//: Back of hand from the wrist to the knuckles can be stiffer but still needs a little flexibility. This area can afford the most thickness on gloves.
Molded knuckle plates, spacious enough inside the gloves to flex your knuckles fine while providing extra knuckle protection because busting your knuckles sucks.
A bit of Kevlar between the third and second knuckles, the part of the fingers where flexibility is least important.
Fingers need to be the most flexible and tactile part of the hand. Lycra/nylon blend (as the lycra material is defined) will give both those qualities while sacrificing the least protection.
The boots are reinforced with plastic plates throughout to protect against penetration.
The Kevlar is 2mm thick over most of the boots, and 1mm thick for flexible joints.
Steel shank for excellent arch support and to maintain boot shape for longevity.

use_action.msg: You slip out of the top of the suit and tie the sleeves around your waist.

name.str_pl: Hub 01 environmental suits (casual)

description: A lightweight environmental suit incorporating Kevlar-lined boots, worn by Hub personnel in their rare forays aboveground.  Colored brown and blue, the upper portion has been tied around the waist casually.

material.//: The boots are reinforced with plastic plates throughout to protect against penetration.
The Kevlar is 2mm thick over most of the boots, and 1mm thick for flexible joints.
Steel shank for excellent arch support and to maintain boot shape for longevity.

use_action.msg: You untie the sleeves and put back on the top of the suit.

description: A single-piece brown and orange environmental suit, tailored in a way that slightly recalls a military flight suit.  The letters "X.E.D.R.A" are inscribed on its back, and a white shoulder patch on the right arm shows an arrow reaching within rings of concentric circles.  It requires a separate gas mask for full protection.

use_action.msg: You slip out of the top of the suit and tie the sleeves around your waist.

name.str_pl: activity suits (casual)

description: A single-piece brown and orange environmental suit, tailored in a way that slightly recalls a military flight suit.  The upper portion has been tied around the waist casually.

use_action.msg: You untie the sleeves and put back on the top of the suit.

description: The WebbStar moisture retention suit utilizes advanced technology to prevent up to 30% of moisture loss through perspiration.  The suit is powered by the micro-motions of the body, especially breathing and walking motions.  Because of this, your walking speed is impaired while wearing it.
A full-body cotton suit.  Makes the apocalypse a truly gentlemanly experience.
A leather bodysuit with padding in high-impact areas, meant for motorcyclists out on the track.  The leather is stiff but makes the armor much sturdier and more protective than lighter counterparts.

A military officer's dress uniform from before the Cataclysm, complete with rank and ribbons.  Just looking at it gives you an air of authority.  Perhaps not the most practical military wear, but a very stylish option.
A sage-green US military flight suit.  It has various insignia embroidered onto it.

A full body multilayered suit of plate armor with a 4mm thick chest piece.  The medium steel has been quenched, tempered and affixed over a full-body layered suit of weight-distributing straps.  The armor has an integrated breathable lycra jumpsuit and the torso has a spall liner of aramid panels.  Electronics run below the surface and circulate cool air to the skin, drawing power from your internal CBM reservoir.

use_action.msg: You turn the climate control on.

name.str_pl: nomad plate armors (on)

description: A full body multilayered light suit of plate armor with a 2mm thick chest piece.  The medium steel has been quenched, tempered and affixed over a full-body layered suit of weight-distributing straps.  The armor has an integrated breathable lycra jumpsuit and the torso has a spall liner of aramid panels.  Electronics run below the surface and circulate cool air to the skin, drawing power from your internal CBM reservoir.

use_action.msg: You turn the climate control on.
